newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: SOCCER-FRANCESCOLI SCORES TWICE TO TAKE RIVER PLATE TOP.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-FRANCESCOLI SCORES TWICE TO TAKE RIVER PLATE TOP.

text.p: Uruguayan veteran Enzo Francescoli, who will be 35 next month, scored twice to set up a River Plate win that put them top of the Argentine championship at the weekend.
Francescoli, a 1986 World Cup survivor, grabbed the first two goals in his team's 5-2 away win over Rosario Central.
The South American champions overtook Cesar Luis Menotti's Independiente who could only manage a 1-1 draw at home to Huracan.
Boca Juniors, who spent $15 million assembling their side for the tournament, scraped at 2-1 win at home over Newell's Old Boys' far less expensive team despite falling behind early on.
